snippet: President Lee Myung-bak’s governing party managed to keep a slim majority in Parliament after elections on Wednesday, a result that is likely to bolster the position of its expected presidential nominee.
abstract: Pres Lee Myung-bak’s New Frontier Party keeps its majority in Parliament after South Koreans vote, a result that is likely to bolster the position of its expected presidential nominee; with Lee’s government reeling from corruption scandals implicating his former aides, Park Geun-hye took over the party leadership early this year and led its election campaign.
lead_paragraph: President Lee Myung-bak’s governing party managed to keep a slim majority in Parliament after elections on Wednesday, a result that is likely to bolster the position of its expected presidential nominee.

headline.seo: South Koreans Vote in Parliamentary Elections
headline.main: Governing Party Retains Edge in South Korean Vote
headline.print_headline: Governing Party Retains Edge in South Korean Vote
